alert.note: Alert for Baldwin Peninsula and Selawik Valley; Chukchi Sea Coast; Eastern Norton Sound and Nulato Hills; Lower Kobuk and Noatak Valleys; Lower Koyukuk and Middle Yukon Valleys; Lower Yukon Valley; Northern and Interior Seward Peninsula; Southern Seward Peninsula Coast; St Lawrence Island and Bering Strait Coast; Upper Kobuk and Noatak Valleys; Upper Kuskokwim Valley; Yukon Delta (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 14 at 3:12PM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...Elevated Water Levels and Local Runoff Possible Next Week... A strong low has moved onshore and will bring periods of heavy precipitation (mixed with snow from the Seward Peninsula west) to the West Coast and Western Interior through through Tuesday. The heavy precipitation combined with an above normal snowpack over higher elevations, will cause a significant increase in snowmelt and will likely cause local ponding of water. Runoff into rivers along the south faces of the Brooks Range southward to the Lower YK Delta over the weekend and early next week will cause water levels to rise and possibly begin the breakup process on many rivers. The potential exists for local ice jams to form and result in elevated water levels. The latest breakup information is available at www.weather.gov/aprfc/breakupMap.
